ComputerStudent1, can you answer this question?
Sure. Here is the game board. There are four categories: Reading Check, Text Type, Text's Purpose, and Persuade and Inform.
Item.speech: Sure. Here is the game board. There are four categories: Reeding Check, Text Type, Text's Purpose, and Persuade and Inform.

Item.text: Each category has 4 questions with point values of 100, 200, 300, and 400. The 400 point questions are the most difficult.
So we are supposed to answer the questions, with the higher point value questions being the hardest. Got it.
Right. Choose a question by pressing on one of the numbers below a category.
And once we do that our question will appear that we can answer by pressing on the options.Got it.

Once you answer a question you will go back to the main page with the game board. Your score will be shown at the top in the score bar. Once you get 2500 points you win. If you answered correctly, the question will turn green if not it will turn red.
_user_ you will choose each question and answer first. I will respond if you get it wrong.
_user_ the points listed up top are your points. So try your best.
Wow. It looks like you got the 3000 points needed to finish this lesson. great job with this activity.
_user_, you were amazing. This was a good chance to practice on everything we learned in the other lessons.
I'm glad you seem to have learned so much using this program.
ComputerTutor, thanks again. See you both next time.
_user_, and ComputerStudent1, hi. How is everyone today?
ComputerTutor, hey. I'm great. What lesson are we covering today?
you actually won't be covering a lesson today. Today you two will review what we have covered.
How are we going to review everything we covered?
You are going to play jeopardy. We will review everything that was covered by playing a game.
ComputerTutor, Can you explain?

Question.text: _user_, Here is your question. Can you tell me what comes at the beginning of a story and is not solved until the end?

Answer.name: ChooseA
Answer.text: I choose the problem.

Answer.name: ChooseB
Answer.text: I choose the resolution. I'm sure of it.

Answer.name: ChooseD
Answer.text: I pick the plot. I have a feeling that's the right answer.

Answer.name: ChooseC
Answer.text: I choose the major event.

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: The correct answer is the problem. The problem is not solved until the end of the story but it comes at the beginning.

Answer.name: FinalAnswer
Answer.text: The problem comes at the beginning of a story and is not solved until the end. The correct answer is the problem.

Answer.name: ResponseA
Answer.text: Yes. That is correct.

Answer.name: ResponseB
Answer.text: I'm sorry, that is incorrect.

Answer.name: ResponseC
Answer.text: That is not right.

Answer.name: ResponseD
Answer.text: That is actually wrong.

Question.text: _user_, Let's try this one again. What comes at the beginning of a story and is not solved until the end?

Answer.name: ChooseA
Answer.text: I pick the problem.

Answer.name: ChooseB
Answer.text: I think the answer is the resolution. The resolution is not solved until the end of a story.

Answer.name: ChooseD
Answer.text: I pick the plot. I believe the plot is not solved until the end of a story.

Answer.name: ChooseC
Answer.text: I choose major event.

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: The plot is what comes at the beginning of a story but it not solved until the end.

Answer.name: FinalAnswer
Answer.text: The plot of a story is what comes in the beginning and is not solved until the story is over.

Answer.name: ResponseA
Answer.text: Yes. That is the right answer.

Answer.name: ResponseB
Answer.text: I'm sorry, that's incorrect.

Answer.name: ResponseC
Answer.text: No, that's not right.

Answer.name: ResponseD
Answer.text: That is not right. Sorry

Question.text: Fill in the blank. The purpose of the instructions on medicine bottles is to what.

Answer.name: ChooseA
Answer.text: Is it to persuade?

Answer.name: ChooseB
Answer.text: Is it to entertain?

Answer.name: ChooseC
Answer.text: Is it to scare the reader?

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: The purpose is to inform. Instructions on medicine bottles inform the reader about aspects of the medicine. For example, the correct dosage to take, any side effects, and if it should be taken with a meal.

Answer.name: FinalAnswer
Answer.text: Directions on medicine bottles inform the reader about aspects of the medicine. For example, the correct dosage to take, any side effects, and if it should be taken with a meal.

Answer.name: ResponseA
Answer.text: Great job.

Answer.name: ResponseB
Answer.text: I am sorry, that is incorrect.

Answer.name: ResponseC
Answer.text: I am sorry, that is incorrect.

Answer.name: ChooseD
Answer.text: I think we should ask how does this text help me solve the problem.

Answer.name: ChooseC
Answer.text: I think we should ask what is the title of the text. That helps. Right?

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: The correct answer is to ask what is the topic of the text. This is always done first.

Answer.name: FinalAnswer
Answer.text: What is the topic of the text should always be asked first for these types of texts.

Question.text: _user_, Fill in the blank. The purpose of this book is to what.

Answer.name: ChooseA
Answer.text: I think it is to inform.

Answer.name: ChooseB
Answer.text: I think it is to persuade.

Answer.name: ChooseC
Answer.text: I think it is to entertain.

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: The purpose of this book is to entertain.

Answer.name: FinalAnswer
Answer.text: The purpose of this book is to entertain. The book is called Roald Dahl's Marvellous Joke Book, and joke books are almost always written to entertain.

Answer.name: ResponseA
Answer.text: I am sorry, that is incorrect.

Answer.name: ResponseC
Answer.text: That is right.
